helpArticles.question: Why we need a selfie during signup

answer.answer: Because we don‚Äôt have branches, where we can make an appointment with you to check your identity, we use your selfie video to check your face matches your photo ID. This check is essential for us to stay compliant with the regulations about checking our customers identity.

We do share certain personal information with third parties to be able to provide our services. 

This includes:

- Card producers and networks like Mastercard, in order for transactions to work üí∏
- Cloud service providers like Amazon Web Services, in order for our platform to work 
- Communication service providers like Intercom, who provide our in app chat functionality üì≤
- Advertising companies like Facebook in order to promote Monzo In these instances only the data needed for them to perform their services are shared.

helpArticles.question: What information does Monzo share with Facebook?

answer.answer:
With social media platforms like Facebook we share a mobile advertising ID, which you can reset or opt out of at any time. We believe this is more privacy friendly than using other identifiers. 

We never send balance, transactions or any other sensitive information. We send events to Facebook to understand when people have installed the Monzo app or used key features. That way, we're able to advertise to the right people!  

For example, if you‚Äôre already our customer, you‚Äôre less likely to get unnecessary prompts to ‚Äúdownload the Monzo app‚Äù. This helps us reach potential customers far more effectively than randomly selected audience types (although this won‚Äôt prevent you from seeing Monzo advertising on Facebook entirely).

helpArticles.question: How can I get a copy of my data?

answer.answer:
You can ask for a copy of the information we hold about you by making a Data Subject Access Request.

You can do this either by [chatting with us](monzo://support_chat?from=button-help-article) or emailing [help@monzo.com](mailto://help@monzo.com).

Please let us know what type of information you're looking for, and we'll process your request once we've verified your identity.

We comply with GDPR and always use appropriate safeguards to make sure your data is protected to EU standards. There is a contract in place with our US Subsidiary that adds our obligations under GDPR into our agreement. 

Your in app chat may be seen by some US employees, but it will still be covered under the Monzo UK security environment. All employees are trained to the same standards as our UK employees about how to protect your data. 

At the moment, we don‚Äôt host any UK customer data in the US at all, it is all stored in the UK. All our workers use web based tools to access customer data and customer data never routinely leaves these tools. US staff work from these same web tools that are hosted in the UK, and all of our usual security measures apply including encryption, and two factor authentication for staff before they can access these tools.

You can write to our legal team by addressing ‚ÄòMonzo Legal Team‚Äô at:

38 Finsbury Square, London, EC2A 1PX.
We take data privacy very seriously. You can read our policy by tapping on the [link](https://monzo.com/privacy-bank/).
[Here](https://monzo.com/terms/) are our terms and conditions ‚Äì they're just under 1,500 words, and hopefully nice and easy to follow.

Any money in your Monzo account is fully protected up to ¬£85,000 by the Financial Services Compensation Scheme (FSCS). That means that if Monzo ever went out of business, you‚Äôd get your money back up to ¬£85,000.

Find out more about the FSCS [here](https://www.fscs.org.uk/what-we-cover/compensation-limits/deposit-limits/).

We believe that we can give you useful, friendly, fast service without branches. 

For example, you can open an account with us in minutes on your phone, and talk to one of our lovely customer service team any time of day or night. The money we save from not operating an expensive network of branches is money we can invest in better service and new features that people really want.

There are some things that banks with branches offer which we do a little differently, with cash deposits being an example. Traditionally you would have visited a bank branch to do this, but with Monzo you can do this at any of the 28,000 PayPoint locations across the UK.

Unfortunately we can‚Äôt advise you on your tax status. But we can point you to where you‚Äôll find more information. 

You should get more information from your embassy in the UK. You can also read more about taxation in the EU [here](https://europa.eu/youreurope/citizens/work/taxes/income-taxes-abroad/index_en.htm).

If you‚Äôre still having trouble, talk to your embassy in the UK.

Unfortunately we can‚Äôt advise you on your tax status. But we can point you to where you‚Äôll find more [information](https://uk.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/internal-revenue-service-u-s-taxes/).

If you‚Äôre still having trouble, talk to your embassy in the UK.
To update your tax residency go to the Account screen, then tap on the 'Tax Residency' option.

helpArticles.question: I'm not a UK tax resident, can I still have an account?

answer.answer:
Yes you can! To be absolutely clear: you can have a Monzo account even if you're not a UK tax resident. But we do need a UK address to offer you an account.

If you don't have a UK address we can't offer you a Monzo account.

Unfortunately we can't advise you on your tax status. But, here are some places where you can find more information. 

EU citizens can find more information [here](https://europa.eu/youreurope/citizens/work/taxes/income-taxes-abroad/index_en.htm).

If you still have questions about your tax status please check with your embassy in the UK.
